value: – lots of small islands and deep, connected inland, comprising the counties of Zadar and Sibenik-Knin
– the county of central Dalmatia, with several bigger islands, mountain ranges close to the coast, and rivieras such as Makarska Riviera, with some sandy beaches in addition to long pebbly beaches
– the county of southern Dalmatia, a narrow strip of land around Dubrovnik, with weak connection to inland (Herzegovina, in another country
— historic "Pearl of the Adriatic", one of the tourist highlights of the Mediterranean
— the main beach resort town on the Makarska Riviera
— historic city with famous centre and Roman palace
— ancient city with Medieval churches and Roman remains

Many inhabitants of Dalmatia are zealous Catholics and they don't mind to brag. So don't be surprised if out of the blue someone is waving a crucifix in your face talking about eternal fires etc.
Most travelers come in through highway

Zagreb-Split-Ravca (next to Ploce and heading Dubrovnik). The highway is modern, fast and safe.

Split and Dubrovnik have international airports and seaports.
